WorkItem.Description:
I've noticed a small issue when adding new files via the VS2012 context menu on a folder. 

Namely that if you try to add a file called MyNameSpace.Class.ts, but there is already a file called MyNameSpace.ts, VS will then say "A file with the name MyNameSpace.ts alreads exists and is open in an editor. Please give the file a unique name to the item you are adding or delete the existing item first".

It looks like only the name prior to the dot is being checked for uniqueness.

This issue is not seen if 'Add New Item' is selected and the window to add different file types is used.

__Reproduction steps:__

Create a new project (mine was a MVC4 SPA)
Add a new folder
Right click on the folder and select 'Add >'
Select 'TypeScript File' from the sub menu, enter a name such as MyNamespace.ts or just MyNamespace
Right click on the same folder and select 'Add >'
Select 'TypeScript file' from the sub menu, enter the name MyNamespace.MyClass.ts or MyNamespace.MyClass
At this point you should see the prompt.

__Environment details:__

Windows 8.1
VS2012 Premium Update 3
Web Essentials (as of 24th of Aug (the one with no preview window :*( )
WorkItem.Summary: Adding new file with dot . in filename via VS
